analyzed: maṅgala aṣṭakam
translated: The Eight Auspicious Ones
Mañjuśrī, the Lord of the World, the crown of the supreme Victor, Jambhala, Vajrasattva,
Maitreya, Vajrapāṇi, the blissful lotus-maker, Rāhula, Bhadra-pāla,

analyzed: buddhaḥ vairocana ādyaḥ tribhuvana namitaḥ kṣīṇa niḥśeṣa doṣa
translated: Buddha, Vairocana and others, bowed to by the three worlds, with all faults exhausted and none remaining,

original: stuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: stuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May all the Bodhisattvas, with equal taste, being pleased, grant the accomplishment of all aims and auspiciousness.

original: hṛṣṭo hūkāravajraḥ paśupatidamako vajraghaṇṭā ca hṛṣṭā
analyzed: hṛṣṭaḥ hūkāra vajraḥ paśupatidamakaḥ vajraghaṇṭā ca hṛṣṭā
translated: Hūṃkāra-vajra, delighted, the tamer of the lord of beasts, and the vajra-bell, delighted,

analyzed: pītaḥ hālāhala āsyaḥ ripu gaṇa mathanaḥ ṭakki rājaḥ mahātmā
translated: Hālāhala, yellow, the destroyer of the host of enemies, the great being, the king of ṭakki,

analyzed: akṣobhyaḥ ratnaketuḥ pratidinam acalaḥ gaṇḍahastiḥ yamāri
translated: Akṣobhya, Ratnaketo, daily unmoving, Gaṇḍa, Hastī, Yamarī,

original: stuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: stuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May all the Bodhisattvas, with equal taste, being pleased, grant the accomplishment of all aims and auspiciousness.

analyzed: saṃghaḥ trailokya bandhuḥ guṇa gaṇa nilayaḥ bodhi cittaḥ su cittaḥ
translated: The Saṅgha, the friend of the three worlds, the abode of many virtues, the awakened mind, the good mind,

analyzed: bodhiḥ ca ānanda siddhaḥ vijita kali malaḥ herukaḥ nīla daṇḍaḥ
translated: And the awakening, the blissful one, the conqueror of the defilements of the degenerate age, Heruka, the blue-staffed one,

analyzed: buddhaḥ sāraṅga rājaḥ vijita jina guṇaḥ sarva sattva anukampī
translated: Buddha, the king of sāranga, the conqueror of the qualities of the Victor, compassionate towards all beings,

original: tuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: tuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May the Bodhisattvas, who are all of one taste and blissful, grant the accomplishment of all aims.

analyzed: prajñā candrāvatārā tad anuja bhṛkuṭī jñāna saṃbhāra bhārā
translated: Prajna, Candra, Avatira, Bhrkuti, Jnanasambharabhara,
Marichi, Maramara, Sakalabhayahara, yellow-colored, three-faced,

original: māyūrī māmakī ca kṣapitaripugaṇā pāṇḍarā rocanādyā
translated: Mayuri, Mamaki, kshapitaripugana, white, red, etc.,

original: stuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: stuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May the Bodhisattvas, who are all of one taste and blissful, grant the accomplishment of all aims.

analyzed: gāndhārī jāṅgulī ca bhujaga hṛta phaṇā khaḍga pāśa aṅkuśa ugrā
translated: Gandhari, Janguli, Bhujagahritaphana, Khadgapa, Ankusika,

analyzed: vārāhī vajra hastā asi paraśu dharā dharmadhātu īśvarī ca
translated: Varahi, Vajrahasta, Ashiparashu, Dharma-dhatvishvari,

original: keyūrī jñānasārā dhvajanihitakarā ṣaṭkarā śābarī ca
translated: Keyuri, Jnanasara, Dhwajanihitakara, Shatkara, Shavari,

original: tuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: tuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May the Bodhisattvas, who are all of one taste and blissful, grant the accomplishment of all aims.

original: vaiṇyā mālyā sugītā prathitajinavare śābarī dhūpavajrā
analyzed: vaiṇyā mālyā sugītā prathita jina vare śābarī dhūpavajrā
translated: Vaineya, Malya, Sugita, Pradhatajina, Shavari, Dhupa-vajra,

analyzed: vaitālī gandha vajrā prahasita vadanā svar gatiḥ ārya tārā
translated: Vaitali, Gandha-vajra, Prahasitavadana, Svargati, Aryatara,

analyzed: lakṣmīḥ buddhasya bodhiḥ sakala bhaya harā śāradā dīpa vajrā
translated: Lakshmi, Buddha, Bodhi, Sakalabhayahara, Sharada, Dipa-vajra,

original: tuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: tuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May the Bodhisattvas, with equal taste, grant auspicious accomplishment of all aims.

analyzed: vaiśālyām dharmacakre prathita nija bale parvate gṛdhrakūṭe
translated: In Vaishali, at the Dharmacakra, on the famous mountain of its own strength, on Vulture Peak,

analyzed: śrāvastyām lumbinīke kṣiti nihita karā koṃkaṇe bodhivṛkṣā
translated: In Lumbini, in Konkana, with hands placed on the ground, at the Bodhi tree,

analyzed: śrīvatsa aśvattha patram sura vara namitam śrīphalam śaṅkha cakram
translated: The auspicious fig tree leaf, revered by the best of gods, the auspicious fruit, the conch and discus,

original: tuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: tuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May the Bodhisattvas, with equal taste, grant auspicious accomplishment of all aims.

original: chatraṃ dūrvā ca padmaṃ dhvajamapi nihitaṃ loro
analyzed: chatram dūrvā ca padmam dhvajam api nihitam loro
translated: The umbrella, durva grass, lotus, and flag are also placed,

analyzed: canā matsya kūrmau
translated: The fish and tortoise,

analyzed: vārāhaḥ pūrṇa kumbhaḥ muni vara vacanam vajra ghaṇṭā ninādaḥ
translated: The boar, the full pot, the words of the best of sages, the sound of the vajra and bell,

analyzed: buddhānām prātihāryam sura vara namitam hāsya lāsye vilāsā
translated: The miracles of the Buddhas, revered by the best of gods, the play of laughter and dance,

original: stuṣṭāḥ sarvārthasiddhiṃ dadatu samarasā maṅgalaṃ bodhisattvāḥ // //
analyzed: stuṣṭāḥ sarva artha siddhim dadatu samarasāḥ maṅgalam bodhisattvāḥ
translated: May the Bodhisattvas, with equal taste, grant auspicious accomplishment of all aims.

analyzed: maṅgala aṣṭakam samāptam
translated: The Eight Auspicious Symbols are complete.
